tit.e: Kiroku Shoen Kenkeijo (Office for the Investigation of Estate Documents)
Kiroku Shoen Kenkeijo (Office for the Investigation of Estate Documents)
Kiroku Shoen Kenkeijo (Office for the Investigation of Estate Documents)

sen.j: 記録荘園券契所（きろくしょうえんけんけいじょ）は平安時代の荘園調査機関。
sen.e: Kiroku Shoen Kenkeijo was a manor (shoen) investigation organization in Heian Period.
Kiroku Shoen Kenkeijo was an organization which investigated manors (shoen) in the Heian Period.
Kiroku Shoen Kenkeijo was an organization which investigated manors (shoen) in the Heian period.
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。

sen.e: It was one of the Ryogenokan (extra statutory offices).
It was one of the Ryogenokan (extra statutory offices).
It was one of the Ryogenokan (extra statutory offices).
It was called Kirokusho for short.
It was called Kirokusho for short.
It was called Kirokusho for short.

sen.j: 1069年（延久元年）後三条天皇の発布した荘園整理令の実施に伴い設置された。
sen.e: In 1069, it was established to carry out the Order for the Reform of "Shoen" by Emperor Go-Sanjo.
In 1069, it was established to carry out the "Order for the Reform of Shoen" by Emperor Go-Sanjo.
In 1069, it was established to carry out the "Order for the Reform of Shoen" by Emperor Gosanjo.

sen.j: 反摂関家的な源経長、学者の大江匡房らが起用された。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Tsunenaga, who was opposed to the house of Sekkan (Fujiwara family's head house who bore the regent position), and OE no Masafusa, a scholar, were assigned to manage this organization.
sen.cmt: 摂関家→the house of Sekkan (head of the Fujiwara family who bore the regent position)[定訳不明]
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Tsunenaga, who was opposed to the house of Sekkan (the head of the Fujiwara family who bore the regent position), and OE no Masafusa, a scholar, were assigned to manage this organization.
sen.cmt: 「Fujiwara family's head house」→「the head of the Fujiwara family」
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Tsunenaga, who was opposed to the house of Sekkan (the head of the Fujiwara family who bore the regent position), and OE no Masafusa, a scholar, were assigned to manage this organization.

sen.j: 主な業務は不正荘園の調査・摘発、書類不備の荘園の没収などを行った。
sen.e: Its main missions were investigation and revelation of illicit manors, and confiscation of manors deficient in documents.
Its main missions were the investigation and exposure of illicit manors, and the confiscation of manors lacking the correct documents.
Its main missions were the investigation and exposure of illicit manors, and the confiscation of manors lacking the correct documents.

sen.j: 後三条の死後には消滅し、1111年（天永2年）、1156年（保元元年）にも設置されたが、後白河天皇によって院庁に吸収される。
sen.e: It was abolished after the death of Emperor Go-Sanjo, set up again in 1111 and in 1156 with its dormant period between, and it was eventually merged into Retired Emperor's Office (Innocho) by Emperor Go-Shirakawa.
It was abolished after the death of Emperor Go-Sanjo, set up again in 1111 and again in 1156, and it was eventually merged into the Retired Emperor's Office (Innocho) by Emperor Go-Shirakawa.
sen.cmt: 「again」挿入,「with its dormant period between」削除, 「the」挿入
sen.e: It was abolished after the death of Emperor Gosanjo, set up again in 1111 and again in 1156, and it was eventually merged into the Retired Emperor's Office (Innocho) by Emperor Goshirakawa.
sen.cmt: Emperor Gosanjo, Goshirakawa としました。

sen.j: 1187年（文治3年）、訴訟や儀式の遂行に関する業務も含めた形で復興される。
sen.e: In 1187, it was reestablished to include also litigation and conducting rituals.
In 1187, it was reestablished to include also litigation and the conduct of rituals in its remit.
sen.cmt: 「conducting rituals」→「the conduct of rituals in its remit」
sen.e: In 1187, it was reestablished to include also litigation and the conduct of rituals in its remit.

sen.j: この時の記録所は内覧九条兼実の管轄下に置かれて公卿の陣定に匹敵する発言力が与えられた。
sen.e: Kirokusho at this time was under the control of Nairan (Document Inspection Secretary) Kanezane KUJYO, and as powerful as Jin-no-sadame (Ancient Cabinet Council).
Kirokusho at this time was under the control of Nairan (the Document Inspection Secretary) Kanezane KUJYO, and as powerful as Jin-no-sadame (Ancient Cabinet Council).
Kirokusho at this time was under the control of Nairan (the Document Inspection Secretary) Kanezane KUJO, and as powerful as Jin-no-sadame (Ancient Cabinet Council).

sen.j: だが、これも後鳥羽天皇の院政開始とともにその院庁に吸収されていくことになる。
sen.e: However, it also was merged into Retired Emperor's Office (Innocho) of Emperor Gotoba as he started his Cloister government.
However, it also was merged into the Retired Emperor's Office (Innocho) of Emperor Gotoba as he started his Cloister government.
However, it also was merged into the Retired Emperor's Office (Innocho) of Emperor Gotoba as he started his Cloister government.

sen.j: 後に後嵯峨天皇の時代に再置されてからは常設化され、1293年（正応6年・永仁元年）には伏見天皇が徳政推進の機関として充実化させた。
sen.e: Later, Emperor Gosaga reestablished it as a permanent organization, and in 1293, Emperor Fushimi vitalized it to pursue his benevolent government.
Later, Emperor Gosaga reestablished it as a permanent organization, and in 1293, Emperor Fushimi expanded it to pursue his 'benevolent government'.
sen.cmt: Is 'benevolent' an opinion, or is it the name of the government? If it is an opinion, it would be better use inverted commas, if a name it will need a capital letter. 「vitalized」→「expanded」
sen.e: Later, Emperor Gosaga reestablished it as a permanent organization, and in 1293, Emperor Fushimi expanded it to pursue his 'benevolent government'.

sen.j: これによってその権限が拡大され、記録所の職員を6班に分けて、寺社・公務・所領争いなど、訴訟の分野ごとに担当する日付や班が定められた（後の建武の新政における雑訴決断所の分離・設置にもにも影響を与えた）。
sen.e: This expanded its power by assigning newly set-up six sections of Kirokusho to different trial dates and different fields of litigation such as temples, shrines, public affairs, and ownership of lands (later this made influences on the setup and division of Zasso ketsudan-sho (ancient civil court) during Kemmu Restoration).

This made its power more extensive by assigning the six newly set-up sections of Kirokusho to different trial dates and different areas of litigation such as temples, shrines, public affairs, and ownership of land (later this influenced the setup and division of Zasso ketsudan-sho (the ancient civil court) during the Kemmu Restoration).
sen.cmt: 「expanded its power」→「made its power more extensive」, 「six」箇所異動,「fields」→「areas」, 「s」削除,「the」挿入x3,「made influences on」→「influenced」
sen.e: This made its power more extensive by assigning the six newly set-up sections of Kirokusho to different trial dates and different areas of litigation such as temples, shrines, public affairs, and ownership of land (later this influenced the setup and division of Zasso ketsudan-sho (the ancient civil court) during the Kenmu Restoration).

sen.j: 鎌倉時代の1321年（元亨元年）に後宇多天皇に代わり親政を開始した後醍醐天皇は記録所を再興する。
sen.e: In 1321, during Kamakura Period, Emperor Godaigo, who replaced Emperor Gouda and started his direct administration, revitalized Kirokusho.
In 1321, during the Kamakura Period, Emperor Godaigo, who replaced Emperor Gouda and started his administration with the revitalization of Kirokusho.
sen.cmt: 「the」挿入, 「direct administration, revitalised」→「administration with the revitalization」
sen.e: In 1321, during the Kamakura period, Emperor Godaigo, who replaced Emperor Gouda, started his administration with the revitalization of Kirokusho.

sen.j: 1333年に鎌倉幕府が滅亡すると、後醍醐は建武の新政を開始して8省の外に記録所を設置して建武政権における最高政務機関とし、重要審議を処理させた。
sen.e: In 1333, after the downfall of Kamakura Shogunate, Emperor Godaigo started Kemmu Administration and established Kirokusho as the supreme administrative agency in addition to the eight Ministries to deal with important deliberations.

In 1333, after the downfall of the Kamakura Shogunate, Emperor Godaigo established the Kemmu Administration and established Kirokusho as the supreme administrative agency in addition to the eight Ministries to deal with important deliberations.

In 1333, after the downfall of the Kamakura Shogunate, Emperor Godaigo started Kenmu Restoration and established Kirokusho as the supreme administrative agency in addition to the eight Ministries to deal with important deliberations during the Kenmu Government.
sen.cmt: 建武政権における を追加しました。
